result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy J. Firkus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Pay costs + DNA Surcharge. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.

Continue with subtance abuse program.  
Continue to meet with sponser at NA meetings.   
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.   
If have not submitted a DNA sample, must do so.

timeConds.notes:
Allow to be served on the Electronic Monitor at the Oxford House with huber for work, counseling, or AA meetings otherwise you need to remain in the House. 
To be served within 60 days of todays date.  
3 days pretrial incarceration credit to be applied against the 90 days jail sentence.  
Go to jail today to set up start date.
****Amended on 04-27-15:  90 days on electronic monitoring can be served through the Department of Corrections on their monitoring system or served during the winter months through the Portage County Sheriff's Department through the 2015-2016 winter season.
Electronic monitoring should commence by May 1, 2015 if through the Department of corrections.*****

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy J. Firkus

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeremy J. Firkus in court.  Louis J Molepske, Jr. appeared for the State of Wisconsin (on behalf of David Knaapen).
Hearing on Defendant's Motion to Modify Sentence.

2:39 p.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.
Defendant has provided a written statement to the Court to modify his sentence; this is in regards to his employment.
Atty Molepske makes a statement to the Court; indicates that the State would not object as long as it would be monitored through another agency.
Court makes statements in regards to the electronic monitoring to the defendant.
Defendant makes statements.

BY THE COURT:
JOC to be modified.
90 days on electronic monitoring can be served through the Department of Corrections on their monitoring system or served during the winter months through the Portage County Sheriff's Department through the 2015-2016 winter season.
Electronic monitoring should commence by May 1, 2015 if through the Department of corrections.

ADDRESS INFO for Jeremy J. Firkus
Current: 2105 Division Street, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 04-15-2015)
Prior: 416 West River Dr., Stevens Point, WI 54481

8:42 a.m. Defendant Jeremy J. Firkus in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states the Defendant to plea to Count 1 and the Parties are free to argue and they weren't sure if a PSI would be ordered.  Court states there will be no PSI ordered.  Count 2 to be DRI.

Defendant enters a plea of:  No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.  Count 2 is dismissed and read in.

ADA Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court and requests Prison or I/S 3 yrs Probation.
Atty Kessler makes sentencing arguments to the Court and requests 2 yrs Probation to run concurrent with his Extended Supervision he is currently serving.
Defendant makes statements to the Court.
Court questions the Defendant.
BY THE COURT:*******PROBATION****
W/H Sentence:  2 yrs Probation: 
Conditions:  Continue with subtance abuse program.  
Continue to meet with sponser at NA meetings.   
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.   
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.  
90 days jail sentence and be allow to be served on the Electronic Monitor at the Oxford House with huber for work, counseling, or AA meetings otherwise you need to remain in the House. 
To be served within 60 days of todays date.  
3 days pretrial incarceration credit to be applied against the 90 days jail sentence.  
Pay costs + DNA surcharge.  
If have not submitted a DNA sample, must do so.  
Go to jail today to set up start date.

Informed of Appeal rights.
Plea hearing on March 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on January 5, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Court calls case at 3:20 p.m. 
Defendant Jeremy J. Firkus in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler. Defendant Jeremy J. Firkus in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 5, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Portage County Community Justice Program Court Referral Form
Preliminary hearing on November 17, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jeremy J. Firkus appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty David R. Knaapen appeared for State of Wisconsin.  

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
Defendant spoke to the Public Defenders office and he does qualify.  He was told to go ahead and schedule for a preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 17, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.  Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  *on all Court Dates

ADA  Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

1:49 PM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of THC and Possession of Paraphernalia.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $1,000 signature  with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  November 10, 2014   @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
